title: Diff. eq. slope field tang line

content.question: Consider the differential equation dy/dx = −xy2/2. Let y = f(x) be the particular solution to this differential equation with the initial condition f(-1) = 2. (a) On the axes provided, sketch a slope field for the given differential equation at the twelve points indicated.

frqParts.text: Consider the differential equation dy/dx = −xy2/2. Let y = f(x) be the particular solution to this differential equation with the initial condition f(-1) = 2. (a) On the axes provided, sketch a slope field for the given differential equation at the twelve points indicated.
(b) Write an equation for the line tangent to the graph of f at x = -1.
(c) Find the solution y = f(x) to the given differential equation with the initial condition f(-1) = 2.

topic.text: 2.2: Defining the Derivative of a Function and Using Derivative Notation

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the relationship between concepts (e.g., rate of change and accumulation) or processes (e.g., differentiation and its inverse process, anti-differentiation) to solve problems.
